original: Archaeal biochemistry features distinctive traits, such as the presence of ether lipids in their cell membranes, including archaeols. Archaea exhibit a broader range of energy sources compared to eukaryotes, utilizing organic compounds like sugars, as well as inorganic substances such as ammonia, metal ions, and hydrogen gas. Among the salt-tolerant archaea, known as Haloarchaea, some species harness sunlight as an energy source, while
